results.title: Sladke hry minuleho leta = Sweet games of last summer
results.brief_description:
This impressionistic adaptation of De Maupassant’s classic novel ‘Mouche’ about a laundress and her five suitors was made for Czech television. Slovak-born director Juraj Herz has a career in film and television that spans more than 35 years and 30 films, working mainly in Prague but also in Slovakia, Germany and France. Although he first came to prominence in the 1960s, his work stands apart from that of other Czech and Slovak New Wave directors in its willingness to cross genres and constitutes a dense exploration of the fantastic.

Credits: Director, Juraj Herz ; photography, Jozef Simoncic.
Cast: Jana Plichtova, Frantisek Velecky, Peter Debnar, Milan Lasica, Julius Satinsky and Lubor Zahon.

results.title: Slacker
results.brief_description: The “slacker” is post-baby boomer, post-Vietnam, post-Communism and post- punk. The “slacker” is looked upon by elder generations as lacking ambition and ignorant of responsibility. The “slacker” is the white-bread, educated and unemployable refuse of American society on a collision course with itself. This rivetting film rejects traditional Hollywood narrative conventions. Instead, seemingly random characters move in and out of the frame, and without ever losing its charm or its anarchic wit, this impressionistic film manages to convey much about the dysfunctional social arrangements governing contemporary America. However, this film does not patronise the “slacker generation”; instead it finds comedy and illumination in the obsessions of the young. A young, nerdy woman holds up a jar containing Madonna’s pap-smear samples and in that jar she finds grace. This externally low-budget experimental feature shows how courage, determination, imagination and sheer will can result in an innovative film, that for all its money and power, Hollywood cannot hope to emulate. “Slacker” is a very, very cool film.

results.title: Skippy the Bush Kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Max Varnel, Bob Austin, John McCallum, Lee Robinson and Norfolk International Pictures
results.brief_description: Features two episodes of the television series. “Double trouble” looks at a rival who is trying to take control of the Waratah National Park; “Chicken” is about Skippy being poisoned by a local farmer who holds a grudge against the head ranger.

results.title: Skyhooks: the video collection
results.creator_credit: Christina Pozzan, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Melbourne pop group ‘Skyhooks’ using video clips, concert footage, backstage interviews and segments from Australian television in the 70’s and 80’s. Formed in 1973, Skyhooks quickly acquired popularity amongst youths, while simultaneously arousing controversy in conservative Australia. This compilation tape presents 19 of their songs drawn from concerts, and video clips interspersed with television appearances, newspaper clippings and interviews.

results.title: Sky trackers
results.creator_credit: John Power, Anthony Buckley and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: It started as innocent fun and turned into an adventure of galactic proportions! Ali (Maia Brewton) lives on a NASA Satellite Tracking Station where her Mum (Pamela Sue Martin) works as a space scientist. A computer whiz, Ali spends her spare time hacking into the station’s mainframe to record her personal diary. One evening while hacking into the computer she discovers a runaway satellite is out of control and heading straight for Earth and is likely to crash nearby. What she doesn’t know is that the satellite contains a load of deadly cargo, so dangerous it threatens the safety of the entire world…

results.title: Skipping class
results.creator_credit: Maureen McCarthy, Chris Warner and Trout Films
results.brief_description: A dramatised re-enactment of cultural conflict and the parent, student, teacher triangle. Steve is a seventeen year old, born in Macedonia and living in Australia, who is not doing well at school. He is caught in between a father, who has high hopes for him, and a burnt out teacher, and in the end it is Steve who suffers most.

results.title: Sky Pirates
results.creator_credit: Colin Eggleston, Michael Hirsh, John Lamond and John Lamond Motion Pictures Production
results.brief_description: Set during World War II, this film is about a plane crashing into the Pacific Ocean and the survivors finding themselves in a time warp. Stars John Hargreaves, Meredith Phillips and Max Phipps.

results.title: Skilled craftsmen: five Australians
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lot of people consider craft a hobby. Something which is undertaken as a source of relaxation and self fulfilment. Many people, however, treat the crafts as a professional livelihood. This film shows the lifestyle of five of these people, each illustrating a different facet of the crafts: Joe McBain, a blacksmith; David Wright, a stained glass artist; Lilija Duks, a weaver; Greg Wain and Victoria Howlett, potters. Narrated by Rod Mullinar

results.title: Sky cries Mary until the grinders cease
results.creator_credit: A J Pruzan, Terry Amidei and Sky Cries Mary
results.brief_description: A pulsating montage of image and music from experimental music artists, Sky Cries Mary. Six pieces are performed - 1. Propergenda 2. Barh House 3. Und die flamen 4. Shakespeare factory 5. When fear stops 6. 9 Nite chant. All music is written and performed by Roderick Auer Stringfellow.
